artifact_name: cup type a(possibly); cup type b(possibly)
Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup of uncertain type; interior: tondo edged with single black ring; black-figure decoration consisting of head, shoulder and part of right arm of youth to left; exterior glazed black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 128, pl. XXXIX, no. 357.3)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 47, pl. 109, no. 17)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 235, no. 210)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1437) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4781 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
